title: Wales Adventure Under Â£50
tagline: Proof that the best things in Wales are free (or nearly)
suitableFor: Budget-conscious adventurers, solo travellers, students, and small groups who enjoy hiking, biking and the outdoors. Confident navigating using maps and public transport is a plus.
notSuitableFor: Those seeking luxury accommodation, fully guided experiences, or those with limited mobility.

stops.title: Mountain Biking - MinorTaur
stops.description: Explore the Coed y Brenin Forest Park on the MinorTaur trail, a fantastic free mountain biking route suitable for families and beginners.

wetAlt.title: Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Browse the exhibits at the visitor centre and grab a coffee while waiting out the rain.

budgetAlt.title: Walking Trails, Coed y Brenin
budgetAlt.description: Explore the forest on foot using the numerous walking trails (free).

stops.title: Cafe Coed y Brenin
stops.description: A cafe at the visitor centre with sandwiches, cakes, and hot drinks.
stops.travelToNext: 1 hour drive to wild swimming location

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at scenic spot
budgetAlt.description: Picnic by the River Mawddach near Ganllwyd.

stops.title: Wild Swimming at Llyn Ogwen
stops.description: Take a refreshing dip in the beautiful Llyn Ogwen, surrounded by dramatic mountain scenery. Be mindful of water temperature and safety.

wetAlt.title: National Slate Museum, Llanberis
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of the Welsh slate industry at this fascinating museum (free entry).

budgetAlt.title: Walk around Llyn Ogwen
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk around the lake instead of swimming.

stops.title: Wild Camping near Llyn Ogwen
stops.description: Find a suitable wild camping spot (check local regulations) near Llyn Ogwen for a truly immersive experience. Remember to leave no trace!

budgetAlt.title: The Snowdon Inn (Y Fricsan)
budgetAlt.description: Budget-friendly campsite in Llanberis with excellent facilities and a sociable atmosphere.

stops.title: Snowdon Summit Hike (Llanberis Path)
stops.description: Hike to the summit of Snowdon via the Llanberis Path, the longest and most gradual route. Allow plenty of time and be prepared for all weather conditions.

wetAlt.title: Electric Mountain Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Take a tour inside Dinorwig Power Station, built inside a mountain. (Small fee applies).

budgetAlt.title: Lower Snowdon Walks
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a shorter walk around Llyn Padarn in Llanberis if you don't want to summit Snowdon.

stops.title: Pete's Eats
stops.description: A legendary cafe in Llanberis serving hearty portions of traditional Welsh food.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Padarn
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches and snacks with a view of the lake.

stops.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
stops.description: Spectacular cliff-top campsite near St Davids, offering stunning coastal views.
stops.travelToNext: 5 min drive to beach for wild camp, or back to civilization

budgetAlt.title: Wild camping near St Davids
budgetAlt.description: Find a discreet wild camping spot along the Pembrokeshire Coast Path. Be responsible and leave no trace.

stops.title: Coasteering at Abereiddy Blue Lagoon (DIY)
stops.description: Experience the thrill of coasteering by exploring the Abereiddy Blue Lagoon, swimming in the lagoon and if feeling brave cliff jumping at your own risk. Check tide times and weather conditions.

wetAlt.title: St Davids Cathedral
wetAlt.description: Explore the magnificent St Davids Cathedral, a historic religious site with stunning architecture (free entry, donations welcome).

budgetAlt.title: Walk the Pembrokeshire Coast Path
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk along the Pembrokeshire Coast Path near Abereiddy.

stops.title: The Sloop Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub in Porthgain serving hearty meals and local ales.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic at Porthgain Harbour
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own lunch with views of the picturesque harbor.

stops.title: Surfing at Whitesands Beach (DIY)
stops.description: Try surfing at Whitesands Beach, one of the best surfing beaches in Wales. Hire a board and wetsuit locally, or bring your own.

wetAlt.title: Oriel y Parc Landscape Gallery and Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Discover art inspired by the Pembrokeshire landscape at this gallery (free entry).

budgetAlt.title: Swimming at Whitesands Beach
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a swim or paddle in the sea at Whitesands Beach (free).

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Welsh weather can be unpredictable, even in summer. Pack layers and be prepared for rain. Coastal areas can be windy.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in Snowdonia, especially during peak season. Arrive early for popular spots. Parking charges apply in many locations.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Campsites, hostels, and activities should be booked in advance, especially during school holidays. Wild camping is permitted in some areas, but check local regulations.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This trip requires a moderate level of fitness due to hiking and biking. Be prepared for steep inclines and uneven terrain.
